<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We were previously party to a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$325.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-year credit facility entered into during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	February 2012
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The credit facility included: a dollar and a designated currency revolving credit facility with sublimits for letters of credit and swingline loans (the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2012 Revolving Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;) and a delayed draw term loan (the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2012 Term Loan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;) together, (the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2012 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:20PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2014 refinancing
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	February 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we entered into a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$325.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;credit facility (the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;) and drew
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$175.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;on a term loan upon closing, which was used to repay all amounts outstanding under the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2012 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;includes the following facilities: (i) a dollar and a designated currency revolving credit facility with sublimits for letters of credit and swingline loans (the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Revolving Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;) and (ii) a term loan facility (the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Term Loan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Certain lenders of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2012 Term Loan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;participated in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Term Loan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and the change in the present value of our future cash flows to these lenders under the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2012 Term Loan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and under the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Term Loan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	10%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Accordingly, we accounted for the refinancing event for these lenders as a debt modification. Certain lenders of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2012 Term Loan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;did not participate in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Term Loan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Accordingly, we accounted for the refinancing event for these lenders as a debt extinguishment. Certain lenders of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2012 Revolving Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;participated in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Revolving Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and provided increased borrowing capacities. Accordingly, we accounted for the refinancing event for these lenders as a debt modification. Certain lenders of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2012 Revolving Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;did not participate in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Revolving Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Accordingly, we accounted for the refinancing event for these lenders as a debt extinguishment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We recorded a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;loss on debt extinguishment related to the write-off of deferred financing costs for the portions of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2012 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;considered to be extinguished. This loss was recognized in the consolidated statements of comprehensive income within loss on debt extinguishment and termination of derivative instruments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In connection with our entry into the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we paid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in financing costs, of which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;were capitalized and, together with a portion of the unamortized deferred financing costs from the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2012 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and prior facilities, are being amortized into interest expense ratably over the term of the new facility. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, deferred financing costs totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively, were included in other assets on our consolidated balance sheets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:20PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Summary of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2014 Credit Facility
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;is secured by the stock and limited liability company interests of certain of our subsidiaries and is guaranteed by our material domestic subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Blackbaud, Inc.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Amounts borrowed under the dollar tranche revolving credit loans and term loan under the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;bear interest at a rate per annum equal to, at our option, (a)&#160;a base rate equal to the highest of (i)&#160;the prime rate, (ii)&#160;federal funds rate plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and (iii)&#160;one month LIBOR plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.00%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(the &#8220;Base Rate&#8221;), in addition to a margin of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.00%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, or (b)&#160;LIBOR rate plus a margin of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.00%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We also pay a quarterly commitment fee on the unused portion of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Revolving Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.15%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.225%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;per annum, depending on our net leverage ratio. At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the commitment fee was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.225%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The term loan under the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;requires periodic principal payments. The balance of the term loan and any amounts drawn on the revolving credit loans are due upon maturity of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	February 2019
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. We evaluate the classification of our debt as current or non-current based on the required annual maturities of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;includes financial covenants related to the net leverage ratio and interest coverage ratio, as well as restrictions on our ability to declare and pay dividends and our ability to repurchase shares of our common stock.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	At December 31, 2016, we were in compliance with our debt covenants under the 2014 Credit Facility.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:20PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Financing for MicroEdge acquisition
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;includes an option to request increases in the revolving commitments and/or request additional term loans in an aggregate principal amount of up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$200.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. On
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	October&#160;1, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we exercised this option, and certain lenders agreed, to increase the revolving credit commitments by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$100.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(the "
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	October 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Additional Revolving Credit Commitments") such that for the period commencing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	October&#160;1, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the aggregate revolving credit commitments available were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$250.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	October 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Additional Revolving Credit Commitments have the same terms as the existing revolving credit commitments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in revolving credit commitments under the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to finance the acquisition of MicroEdge.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:20PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Financing for Smart Tuition acquisition
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	July&#160;17, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we again exercised this option and certain lenders agreed to increase the revolving credit commitments by an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$100.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	July 2015

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	July&#160;17, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the aggregate revolving credit commitments available were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$350.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	July 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Additional Revolving Credit Commitments have the same terms as the existing revolving credit commitments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	October&#160;2, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we drew down a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$186.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;revolving credit loan under the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to finance the acquisition of Smart Tuition.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the required annual maturities related to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014 Credit Facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;were as follows:
</FONT>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_59"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="4">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:89%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:9%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#ACACAC;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

</A>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;" HREF="#A201610-K_HTM_SD38BEB865E2F564AB6EBD52966DA7EE1">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Blackbaud, Inc.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:20PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-LEFT:AUTO;MARGIN-RIGHT:AUTO;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="1">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #71BF43;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	10. Derivative Instruments
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We use derivative instruments to manage our variable interest rate risk. In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	February 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, in connection with the refinancing of our debt, we terminated the two interest rate swap agreements associated with the 2012 Credit Facility. As part of the settlement of our swap liabilities, we recorded a loss of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which was recognized in the consolidated statements of comprehensive income within loss on debt extinguishment and termination of derivative instruments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	March 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we entered into a new interest rate swap agreement (the "March 2014 Swap Agreement"), which effectively converts portions of our variable rate debt under the 2014 Credit Facility to a fixed rate for the term of the March 2014 Swap Agreement. The initial notional value of the March 2014 Swap Agreement was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$125.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;with an effective date beginning in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	March 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	March 2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the notional value of the March 2014 Swap Agreement will decrease to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$75.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for the remaining term through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	February 2018
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. We designated the March 2014 Swap Agreement as a cash flow hedge at the inception of the contract.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	October 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we entered into an additional interest rate swap agreement (the "
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	October 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Swap Agreement"), which effectively converts portions of our variable rate debt under the 2014 Credit Facility to a fixed rate for the term of the October 2015 Swap Agreement. The notional value of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	October 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Swap Agreement was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$75.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;with an effective date beginning in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	October 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and maturing in February 2018. We designated the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	October 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Swap Agreement as a cash flow hedge at the inception of the contract.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The fair values of our derivative instruments were as follows as of:
</FONT>
<EFX_BALANCE_SHEET>
<A NAME="FIS_BALANCE_SHEET_3"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="8">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:50%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:21%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:13%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:12%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#ACACAC;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#FFFFFF;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(dollars in thousands)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#ACACAC;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#FFFFFF;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Balance sheet location
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#ACACAC;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#FFFFFF;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	December&#160;31,
<BR>
	2016
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#ACACAC;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #71BF43;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#F4F4F4;">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(1,802
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #71BF43;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#F4F4F4;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	)
</FONT>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our policy requires that derivatives used for hedging purposes be designated and effective as a hedge of the identified risk exposure at the inception of the contract. Accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) includes unrealized gains or losses from the change in fair value measurement of our derivative instruments each reporting period and the related income tax expense or benefit. Changes in the fair value measurements of the derivative instruments and the related income tax expense or benefit are reflected as adjustments to accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) until the actual hedged expense is incurred or until the hedge is terminated at which point the unrealized gain (loss) is reclassified from accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) to current earnings. The estimated net amount of losses that are recorded in accumulated other comprehensive loss as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;that is expected to be reclassified into earnings within the next twelve months is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	insignificant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. There were no ineffective portions of our interest rate swap derivatives during the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. See
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Note 14
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to these consolidated financial statements for a summary of the changes in accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) by component.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #71BF43;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	11. Commitments and Contingencies
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:20PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Historical Leases
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We lease our headquarters facility under a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	15
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-year lease agreement which was entered into in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	October 2008
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and has
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-year renewal options. The current annual base rent of the lease is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, payable in equal monthly installments. The base rent escalates annually at a rate equal to the change in the consumer price index, as defined in the agreement, but not to exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in any year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We have a lease for office space in Austin, Texas which terminates on September 30, 2023, and has
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-year renewal options. The current annual base rent of the lease is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The base rent escalates annually between
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;based on the terms of the agreement. The rent expense is recorded on a straight-line basis over the length of the lease term. At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we had a standby letter of credit of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for a security deposit for this lease.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We have provisions in our leases that entitle us to aggregate remaining leasehold improvement allowances of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. These amounts are being recorded as a reduction to rent expense ratably over the terms of the leases. The leasehold improvement allowances have been included in the table of operating lease commitments below as a reduction in our lease commitments ratably over the then remaining terms of the leases. The timing of the reimbursements for the actual leasehold improvements may vary from the amounts reflected in the table below.
</FONT>
</DIV>

	Table of Contents

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Blackbaud, Inc.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We have also received quarterly South Carolina state incentive payments as a result of locating our headquarters facility in Berkeley County, South Carolina. These amounts are recorded as a reduction of rent expense upon receipt and were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. These quarterly state incentive payments related to our current headquarters facility ended in 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Total rent expense was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$11.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$10.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$9.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:20PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Lease for New Headquarters Facility
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In May 2016, we entered into a lease agreement for a new headquarters facility to be built in Charleston, South Carolina (the "New Headquarters Facility"). The landlord is responsible for the design, development and construction of the New Headquarters Facility. Construction of the New Headquarters Facility will proceed in two phases. Phase One will include a building with approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	172,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;rentable square feet, which is expected to be completed in the first quarter of 2018. The lease agreement also grants us a Phase Two option to request that the landlord construct and lease to us a second office building and related improvements. Total rent payments and leasehold improvement allowances for Phase One are estimated to be approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$102.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$12.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively, over the life of the lease agreement, plus additional amounts for Phase Two, if applicable. The lease agreement is for a period of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	twenty
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years beginning on the date of substantial completion of construction by the landlord, which is estimated to be in the first quarter of 2018, and ending in the first quarter of 2038. The lease agreement provides for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	four
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;renewal periods of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years each at a base rent equal to the then prevailing market rate for comparable buildings. We expect to receive quarterly South Carolina state incentive payments as a result of locating our new headquarters facility in Berkeley County, South Carolina, which will be recorded as a reduction of rent expense upon receipt.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the future minimum lease commitments related to lease agreements, net of related lease incentives, were as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	We utilize third-party technology in conjunction with our solutions, services and operations with contractual arrangements varying in length from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years. In certain cases, these arrangements require a minimum annual purchase commitment. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the remaining aggregate minimum purchase commitment under these arrangements was approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$38.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2021
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	2016 Form 10-K
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

</DIV>

<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage92"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;" HREF="#A201610-K_HTM_SD38BEB865E2F564AB6EBD52966DA7EE1">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Blackbaud, Inc.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	that it is probable that a loss has been incurred related to solution or service indemnifications, any such loss that could be reasonably estimated would be recognized. We have not identified any losses and, accordingly, we have not recorded a liability related to these indemnifications.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:20PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Guarantees and indemnification obligations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We enter into agreements in the ordinary course of business with, among others, customers, creditors, vendors and service providers. Pursuant to certain of these agreements we have agreed to indemnify the other party for certain matters, such as property damage, personal injury, acts or omissions of ours, or our employees, agents or representatives, or third-party claims alleging that the activities of its contractual partner pursuant to the contract infringe a patent, trademark or copyright of such third party.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:20PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Legal contingencies
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We are subject to legal proceedings and claims that arise in the ordinary course of business. We record an accrual for a contingency when it is both probable that a liability has been incurred and the amount of the loss can be reasonably estimated. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, in our opinion, there was not at least a reasonable possibility that these actions arising in the ordinary course of business will have a material adverse effect upon our consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows and, therefore, no material loss contingencies were recorded.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A201610-K_HTM_SCD937A663E0D58B18E713A3B7411C43B">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="1">
</TD>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	12. Income Taxes
</FONT>
</DIV>

</TABLE>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We file income tax returns in the U.S. for federal and various state jurisdictions as well as in foreign jurisdictions including Canada, the United Kingdom, Australia and Ireland. We are generally subject to U.S. federal income tax examination for calendar tax years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as well as state and foreign income tax examinations for various years depending on statutes of limitations of those jurisdictions.
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Total current taxes
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The following summarizes the components of income before provision for income taxes:
</FONT>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_63"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="10">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:61%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As discussed in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Note 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to these consolidated financial statements, we early adopted ASU 2016-09 relating to stock-based compensation in 2016. Under ASU 2016-09, tax benefits in excess of compensation costs (windfalls) generated upon the exercise or settlement of stock awards are no longer recognized as additional paid-in capital but are instead recognized as a reduction to income tax expense. This change in accounting for income taxes is effective on a prospective basis as of the beginning of the 2016 fiscal year. Upon adoption of ASU 2016-09 in 2016, we recorded a benefit to tax expense of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$7.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. We recorded excess tax benefits from the exercise and vesting of stock-based compensation of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$7.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in additional paid-in capital during the years ended December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	A portion of our South Carolina credit carryforward expired in 2015 and 2016 and this is reflected in the rate increase for state credits, net of federal benefit. This increase was offset by the release of the related state credit valuation reserve and additional state research credits generated in 2015 and 2016, which are reflected in the rate decrease for change in valuation reserve.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Blackbaud, Inc.
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The significant components of our deferred tax assets and liabilities were as follows:

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, our federal, foreign and state net operating loss carryforwards for income tax purposes were approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$28.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$6.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$36.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. The federal and state net operating loss carryforwards are subject to various Internal Revenue Code limitations and applicable state tax laws. If not utilized, the federal net operating loss carryforwards will begin to expire in 2028 and the state net operating loss carryforwards will expire over various periods beginning in 2017. Our foreign net operating loss carryforwards have an unlimited carryforward period. Our federal and foreign tax credit carryforwards for income tax purposes were insignificant. Our state tax credit carryforwards for income tax purposes were approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$9.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, net of federal benefit. If not utilized, the state tax credit carryforwards will begin to expire in 2017. A portion of the foreign and state net operating loss carryforwards and state credit carryforwards have a valuation reserve due to management's uncertainty regarding the future ability to use such carryforwards.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The total amount of unrecognized tax benefit that, if recognized, would favorably affect the effective tax rate was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Certain prior period amounts relating to our 2014 acquisitions are covered under indemnification agreements and, therefore, we have recorded a corresponding indemnification asset. We recognize accrued interest and penalties, if any, related to unrecognized tax benefits as a component of income tax expense. The total amount of accrued interest and penalties included in the consolidated balance sheet as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	insignificant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The total amount of interest and penalties included in the consolidated statements of comprehensive income as an increase or decrease in income tax expense for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	insignificant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We have taken federal and state tax positions for which it is reasonably possible that the total amounts of unrecognized tax benefits might decrease within the next twelve months. This possible decrease could result from the expiration of statutes of limitations. The reasonably possible decrease at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	insignificant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	For our undistributed earnings of foreign subsidiaries, which we do not consider to be significant, we concluded that these earnings would be permanently reinvested in the local jurisdictions and not repatriated to the United States. Accordingly, we have not provided for U.S. federal income taxes and foreign withholding taxes on those undistributed earnings of our foreign subsidiaries. It is not practicable to estimate the amount that might be payable if some or all of such earnings were to be remitted.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A201610-K_HTM_SFF07702F35575B2C81693562C949A812">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:20PX;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-LEFT:AUTO;MARGIN-RIGHT:AUTO;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="1">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #71BF43;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:12PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	13. Stock-based Compensation
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:20PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Employee stock-based compensation plans
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Under the 2016 Equity and Incentive Compensation Plan (the "2016 Equity Plan"), we may grant incentive stock options, nonstatutory stock options, stock appreciation rights, restricted stock, restricted stock units, other stock awards and cash incentive awards to employees, directors and consultants. We maintain other stock-based compensation plans including the 2008 Equity Incentive Plan (the &#8220;2008 Equity Plan&#8221;) and the 2004 Stock Plan, under which no additional grants may be made, and the 2009 Equity Compensation Plan for Employees from Acquired Companies, under which we may grant shares of common stock to employees pursuant to employment contracts or other arrangements entered into in connection with past and future acquisitions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In connection with the acquisition of Kintera in July 2008, we maintain the Kintera, Inc. Amended and Restated 2003 Equity Incentive Plan, as amended (the &#8220;Kintera 2003 Plan&#8221;), which we assumed upon the acquisition of Kintera. In connection with the acquisition of Convio in May 2012, we maintain the Convio, Inc. 1999 Stock Option/Stock Issuance Plan, as amended (the &#8220;Convio 1999 Plan&#8221;) and Convio, Inc. 2009 Stock Incentive Plan, as amended (the &#8220;Convio 2009 Plan&#8221;), which we assumed upon the acquisition of Convio. Our Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors administers all of these plans and the stock-based awards are granted under terms determined by them.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-LEFT:AUTO;MARGIN-RIGHT:AUTO;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">

	. We issue common stock from our pool of authorized stock upon exercise of stock options and stock appreciation rights, vesting of restricted stock units or upon granting of restricted stock.

	4,745
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #71BF43;">

</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The majority of the stock-based awards granted under these plans have a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-year contractual term. Stock appreciation rights (&#8220;SARs&#8221;) have contractual lives of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years. Awards granted to our executive officers and certain members of management are subject to accelerated vesting upon a change in control as defined in the employees&#8217; retention agreement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:20PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Expense recognition
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We recognize compensation expense associated with stock options and awards with performance or market based vesting conditions on an accelerated basis over the requisite service period of the individual grantees, which generally equals the vesting period. We recognize compensation expense associated with restricted stock awards and SARs on a straight-line basis over the requisite service period of the individual grantees, which generally equals the vesting period. Compensation expense is recognized net of estimated forfeitures such that expense is recognized only for those stock-based awards that are expected to vest. A forfeiture rate is estimated at the time of grant and revised, if necessary, in subsequent periods if actual forfeitures differ from initial estimates.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Stock-based compensation expense is allocated to cost of revenue and operating expenses on the consolidated statements of comprehensive income based on where the associated employee&#8217;s compensation is recorded. The following table summarizes stock-based compensation expense:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_69"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-LEFT:AUTO;MARGIN-RIGHT:AUTO;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="10">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:61%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:11%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:11%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:11%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#ACACAC;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.8 years

<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;" HREF="#A201610-K_HTM_SD38BEB865E2F564AB6EBD52966DA7EE1">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Blackbaud, Inc.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to consolidated financial statements (continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:20PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Restricted stock awards
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We have granted shares of common stock subject to certain restrictions under the 2016 Equity Plan, the 2008 Equity Plan and the 2004 Stock Plan. Restricted stock awards granted to employees vest in equal annual installments generally over four years from the grant date subject to the recipient&#8217;s continued employment with us. Restricted stock awards granted to non-employee directors vest after one year from the date of grant or, if earlier, immediately prior to the next annual election of directors, provided the non-employee director is serving as a director at that time. The fair market value of the stock at the time of the grant is amortized on a straight-line basis to expense over the period of vesting. Recipients of restricted stock awards have the right to vote such shares and receive dividends.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>

	, and changes during the year then ended:
</FONT>

	(1)

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">

	The intrinsic value is calculated as the market value as of the end of the fiscal period.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The total fair value of restricted stock awards that vested during the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$14.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$10.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$10.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. The weighted average grant-date fair value of restricted stock awards granted during the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$48.82
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$37.89
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:20PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Restricted stock units
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We have also granted restricted stock units subject to certain restrictions under the 2016 Equity Plan and the 2008 Equity Plan. In addition, we assumed restricted stock units in connection with the Convio acquisition. Restricted stock units granted to employees vest in equal annual installments generally over three years from the grant date subject to the recipient&#8217;s continued employment with us. We have also granted restricted stock units for which vesting is subject to meeting certain performance and/or market conditions. Restricted stock units granted with a market condition had a fair market value assigned at the grant date based on the use of a Monte Carlo simulation model. The fair market value of the stock at the time of the grant is amortized to expense on a straight-line basis over the period of vesting except for awards with market or performance conditions, which are amortized on an accelerated basis over the period of vesting.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:FRUTIGER LT 45 LIGHT,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
